conclusion: To determine the temperature at state C, use the ideal gas law and properties of the cycle ABCDA.
Process AB is isochoric with pressure increasing from P1 to P2.
Process BC is isobaric with pressure at P2 and volume increasing from V1 to V2.
Process CD is isochoric with volume constant at V2 and pressure decreasing from P2 to P1.
Process DA is isobaric with pressure at P1 and volume decreasing from V2 to V1.
The ideal gas law is PV = nRT.
At state A: PA = P1, VA = V1, TA = T0.
At state B: PB = P2, VB = V1.
At state C: PC = P2, VC = V2.
Using ideal gas law at state A: P1 V1 = nRT0.
Using ideal gas law at state C: P2 V2 = nRT_C.
Express nR as nR = P1 V1 / T0.
Substitute nR into equation for state C: P2 V2 = (P1 V1 / T0) T_C.
Solve for T_C: T_C = (P2 V2 T0) / (P1 V1).
The temperature at state C is T_C = (P2 V2 T0) / (P1 V1).
